intro: Talisia clathrata subsp. clathrata, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, pendulous yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, ovate leaflets. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. The flowers are rich in nectar, making it an important resource for pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds.
